results.title: The Agrarian revolution
results.creator_credit: W. Hugh Baddeley and Hugh Baddeley Productions
results.brief_description: Deals with the enclosure of common lands, one of the most dramatic happenings in British history, and describes the changes in agriculture over the last two hundred and fifty years. Commentary by spoken by Dick Graham.

results.title: Trio for three angles
results.brief_description:
Animated free-swinging angles help students discover the relationships of a triangle’s different components. Shows separate sections of equilateral, isosceles and scalene trangles.
Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Snowbound
results.creator_credit: Robert Young, Linda Gottlieb and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: A shortened version of the motion picture “Snowbound”. Features two teenagers who learn to understand themselves and each other when they are caught in a desolate area during a snow storm. Written by Edward Pomerantz and Kurt Villadsen from the book by Harry Mazer.

results.title: Shoplifting: Sharon's Story
results.creator_credit: Dennis Cull, Yvonne Chotzen and Auro Productions
results.brief_description: Tells the story of a young woman who steals from a department store and is subsequently arrested. Shows her reactions and as those of her parents, to the humiliation of search, interrogation, detention, family, confrontation and court procedure.

results.title: The Prophets: Pont-Aven, the Nabis and Toulouse-Lautrec
results.creator_credit: Pierre Alibert, International Film Bureau and Les Films du Cypres
results.brief_description: Works of the “Nabis” - Vuillard, Serusler, Ranson, Roussel and Bonnard, whose basic principle was that the picture is not a description and should differ from the model. Compares the “Nabis” with Toulouse-Lautrec to show how both confirmed change in painting and helped open the way for modern painting. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
results.title_for_label: The Prophets: Pont-Aven, the Nabis and Toulouse-Lautrec

results.title: Granny lives in Galway
results.brief_description: An excerpt from the film ‘Fligh of the Doves’, focusing on a story about a brother and sister who escape from a cruel stepfather in England and search for their grandmother who lives in a cottage in Galway, Ireland. Based on the book by Walter Macken.

results.title: The Champion = Battling Charlie [SILENT]
results.creator_credit: Charles Chaplin, Essanay Film Manufacturing Company and Griffiths Short Films
results.brief_description: The Champion, Chaplin’s third film for Essanay, is easily one of the funniest and is his most advanced film to date in plotting and characterisation. We meet Charlie and his bulldog sharing a hot dog. As they pass a gymnasium advertising for sparring partners, Charlie finds a lucky horseshoe and decides to give sparring a go, putting the horseshoe into his left boxing glove. Obviously Charlie has a special advantage and eventually wins his way through to the big championship fight against Champ (Bud Jamison). Along the way the beautiful daughter of the Gym owner,(Edna Purviance) is attracted to Charlie and likewise Charlie is interested in her. The hilarious slapstick prizefight is pretty even at first but when Charlie appears to be getting the worst of it, his bulldog springs to the rescue.

results.title: Afrikaner experience: politics of exclusion
results.creator_credit: Peter F. Davis and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: Explores the history of the Afrikaners from the arrival of the Dutch in 1652 to South Africa in the 1970’s with its Apartheid System. The film is useful for its historical significance. This film contains footage from the film by Barry Callaghan entitled “South Africa/the white laager”. This film attempts to create an understanding of the historical events leading to and resulting in the Afrikaner rule of South Africa. It also examines the concept of racial superiority , and the connection between such ideology and economic profit.

results.title: The Animals are crying
results.creator_credit: Peter Beltz, Paul Martin Smith and PMS Films
results.brief_description: This film shows how pet owners fail to understand the responsibility of raising animals by telling about the garbage men who almost discard a box until they realise there are live kittens in it. Also suggests owners spay their female cats. (Short version). Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Pacific Island life: village life
results.creator_credit: Hermann Schlenker and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description:
Part of a series of five films which examine aspects of life in the Pacific Islands. Shows daily life in the village, including the building of a home.
Suitable for middle and upper primary level.
